author: Chandra Philip
description: Ontario police are alerting drivers to be cautious after a series of attempted thefts targeting the same model of pickup truck. The Ontario Provincial Police (OPP) said it is searching for suspects following three incidents involving Toyota Tundra trucks in the Town of Orangeville that occurred early in the morning on Dec. 16. Police responded […]
title: Ontario Police Warn Owners of One Particular Truck Model About Repeated Thefts

author: Lily Zhou
description: Beijing continued to pressure Japan over Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s remarks that a war on Taiwan may trigger actions of Japan's defense response.
title: China, Japan Clash at UN in Ongoing Feud Over Taiwan

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Presidential Elections in Honduras, Plane Crash in US, and Protests in Belgium

author: Matthew Horwood
description: A judge will soon decide whether the Crown will be able to seize Freedom Convoy organizer Chris Barber’s truck “Big Red” that he utilized during the 2022 trucker protest. Justice Heather Perkins-McVey will read her decision at the Ottawa Courthouse on Dec. 19. According to the Justice Centre for Constitutional Freedoms (JCCF), which has provided […]
title: Decision on Seizure of Freedom Convoy Organizer’s Truck to Come Friday

author: Eva Fu, Nicholas Zifcak
description: Linda Sun maintained close relationships with Chinese officials and boasted about her influence over New York state, according to court records.
title: 5 Takeaways From Ex-Hochul Aide’s Chinese Agent Trial

author: Bill Pan
description: The company must provide full access to personal data collected on any user in the European Union who requests it.
title: Meta Ordered to Provide User’s Complete Personal Data in Austrian Supreme Court Ruling

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: B.C. Premier David Eby says Ottawa must increase its investments in provincial infrastructure improvements, citing the urgent need for upgrades to the flood-ravaged Highway 1 that runs through the Fraser Valley. Major flooding last week led to the shutdown of large portions of Highway 1, a critical artery for truckers travelling to B.C. ports and […]
title: Flooding Prompts BC Premier to Urge Federal Aid for Provincial Infrastructure

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney provided insight into his relationship with U.S. President Donald Trump and the status of trade negotiations between the two nations during year-end interviews with several media outlets. Carney’s interviews with the media touched on several 2025 developments, such as the United States imposing a series of tariffs on Canada, Conservative MPs […]
title: Carney Talks About ‘Friendly’ Relations With Trump, Floor-Crossers in Year-End Interviews

author: The Canadian Press
description: Quebec Health Minister Christian Dubé says he’s leaving cabinet to sit as an Independent. In a statement on social media, Dubé says he is not the right person to continue negotiations with family doctors over changes to a controversial doctor-payment law that he helped push through the legislature. The Coalition Avenir Québec government passed Bill […]
title: Quebec Health Minister Christian Dubé Says He’s Resigning From Cabinet

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Alberta Conservative MP Rachael Thomas says government-funded Skate Canada shouldn’t use public funding to “punish” the province of Alberta over its law prohibiting transgender athletes in female sports. Skate Canada said on Dec. 16 that it will not host any national or international-level events in Alberta, as it disagrees with the province’s Fairness and Safety […]
title: Tory MP Says Publicly Funded Skate Canada Should Not Penalize Alberta Over Its Female-Only Sports Law

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Researchers also studied a Reddit forum dedicated to discussing AI companions, finding that users reported symptoms of withdrawal during service outages.
title: 1 in 3 Britons Use AI for Emotional Support, Companionship, Social Interaction: Study

author: Eric Meger, Pierre Leblanc
description: Commentary Canada is entering a period of accelerated defence investment. The new federal government has committed to NATO spending benchmarks, and operational commanders must deliver tangible capabilities quickly. Nowhere is the gap more visible than in the Arctic, where maritime awareness remains fragile despite its centrality to sovereignty, security, and alliance credibility. The threat posed […]
title: Canada’s Underutilized Arctic Radar Advantage

author: Naveen Athrappully
description: The bank revised up growth rate estimates for the euro zone.
title: European Central Bank Keeps Interest Rates Steady; Inflation Expected to Stabilize

author: Chandra Philip
description: A winter storm that blew through the Prairie provinces is making its way to Ontario and Quebec, with up to 30 centimetres of snow expected to hit some regions, coupled with wind gusts of up to 60 kilometres per hour. Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) issued storm warnings for several prairie regions on Dec. […]
title: Winter Storm Moves Into Northern Ontario, Quebec, Bringing Heavy Snow, Wind Gusts

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Ottawa and Ontario have signed a cooperation agreement aiming to speed up approval timelines and reduce regulatory burden on major projects, including the road to the Ring of Fire region in northern Ontario. The agreement introduces a “one project, one review” approach to major projects in Ontario, meant to streamline the environmental impact assessment process […]
title: Ottawa, Ontario Sign Agreement to Speed Up Major Projects Approvals, Including Ring of Fire

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Canada’s grocery code of conduct is set to take effect on Jan. 1, a move meant to bring “fairness” to the grocery supply chain. But what will the change mean for shoppers dealing with the ever-rising cost of food? The Canada grocery code of conduct aims to level the playing field for suppliers and smaller […]
title: What Jan. 1’s New Grocery Code of Conduct Means for Shoppers in Canada

author: Naveen Athrappully
description: Fuel theft, including the smuggling of crude oil, is the 'most significant non-drug revenue source' for Mexican cartels, Treasury said.
title: US Treasury Sanctions Mexican Cartel Over Fuel Theft

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The president is ramping up pressure on the Maduro regime, linking the tanker blockade to a decades-old seizure of U.S. oil assets.
title: Trump Demands Venezuela Return Seized US Oil Assets After Ordering Tanker Blockade

author: Guy Birchall
description: The European Commission has said that the meeting will not end without a decision on how to keep funding Kyiv for the next two years.
title: EU Leaders Meet to Decide on Using Frozen Russian Assets for Ukraine

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is backing Alberta’s law to ban transgender athletes from female-only sports after Skate Canada announced it would no longer host any national or international-level events in the province. Skate Canada announced the new policy on Dec. 16, saying it disagrees with Alberta’s Fairness and Safety in Sport Act, which came into […]
title: Poilievre Backs Alberta’s Rule Excluding Transgender Athletes From Women’s Sports

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal government is defending its decision to award a contract worth up to $1.1 million for advice on deploying artificial intelligence to a Canadian branch of Deloitte, a global consulting firm that is under fire for AI-related blunders. However, Employment and Social Development Canada says there will be consequences if the company violates the […]
title: Feds Defend $1.1-Million Deloitte Contract for AI Advice After Firm Admitted Mistakes

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The Coalition's push includes cutting funding to institutions that support producing anti-Semitic content.
title: Opposition Calls for Parliament Recall, Pushes to Strip Citizenship From Terrorists, Hate Preachers

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The incident comes just days after the Bondi Beach terror attack that claimed the lives of 15 people.
title: Heavily Armed Police Subdue 7 Men Preparing for ‘Violent Act’

author: PA Media
description: The sentence for the driver who ploughed through crowds at Liverpool FC’s victory parade will be considered by the Attorney General’s Office after requests for it be reviewed as being too lenient. Paul Doyle, 54, was jailed for 21 years and six months on Tuesday after he pleaded guilty to 31 offences relating to the […]
title: Requests for Liverpool Parade Crash Driver’s Sentence to Be Reviewed

author: PA Media
description: Two of the country’s biggest police forces plan to arrest protesters who chant “globalise the intifada” in a move decried as political repression by campaigners. The heads of Greater Manchester Police (GMP) and the Metropolitan Police said both forces will “act decisively and make arrests”, adding the measures are designed to “deter intimidation”. Chief Rabbi […]
title: Vow to Arrest Protesters Over Intifada Chant Decried as Political Repression

author: PA Media
description: Temperatures are set to drop next week bringing overnight frost and the potential for snow, the Met Office said. Heavy rain is forecast on Wednesday and Thursday this week, with weather warnings in force amid potential travel disruption and flooding. More settled but colder conditions are expected to arrive next week, with temperatures closer to […]
title: Temperatures Forecast to Drop Next Week With Potential for Snow

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: A report has found poor communications and a lack of escalation of concerns contributed to emergency call outages.
title: ‘Unacceptable’: Optus Admits Process Breakdowns After 000 Outage Linked to Multiple Deaths

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The victims of the Bondi Beach terror attack were well-loved, highly esteemed members of their community.
title: Who Were the Victims of the Bondi Terror Attack?

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The package covers funerals, repatriation, travel costs, and includes new community hubs and security funding.
title: NSW Announces Up to $75,000 for Bondi Attack Victims’ Families

author: Cindy Li
description: The prime minister praised the Bondi heroes who faced Sunday's act of 'pure evil' with bravery.
title: ‘At the Worst of Times, We See the Best of the Australian Character’: Albanese at Bondi Memorial

author: Reuters
description: MANILA, Dec. 17—There is no evidence indicating that the two suspects involved in the Bondi Beach attack received any form of military training while in the Philippines, the Philippines’ National Security Adviser said on Wednesday. In a statement, Eduardo Año said that a mere visit to the country does not substantiate allegations of terrorist training, and the […]
title: No Evidence Alleged Bondi Gunmen Received Military Training in the Philippines, Says Security Adviser

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: With 2025 drawing to a close, the Australian Bureau of Statistics has released data on how Australians spent their 2024.
title: Australians Spent Most of Their Free Time in Front of the TV in 2024

author: Troy Myers
description: This strike was the latest military action in President Donald Trump’s efforts to halt drug trafficking to the United States.
title: US Airstrike on Drug Boat Kills 4 in Eastern Pacific

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Top U.S. trade negotiator Jamieson Greer said Canada must change a number of its policies including in the dairy sector if it wants the United States to commit to a long-term renewal of the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA). In a portion of his closed-door remarks to members of Congress that were released to the public Dec. […]
title: US Trade Representative Cites Access to Canadian Dairy and Alcohol Markets as Conditions for USMCA Renewal

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Tougher hate laws, visa cancellations, education reforms and disaster support form part of a federal crackdown on anti-semitism.
title: Albanese Flags New Hate Laws and Visa Powers After Bondi Terror Attack

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: A new online tool, developed by the Greens, allows Australians living in NSW to find out how many guns and gun owners are nearby.
title: Australian Greens Release Website Revealing How Many Guns in Each NSW Postcode

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The Canadian military intelligence operator charged with leaking information to a foreign entity is accused of exposing the identity of a Canadian Armed Forces covert operator, according to court documents reviewed by The Epoch Times. Master Warrant Officer Matthew Robar, 43, was arrested and charged with eight offenses, including two alleged violations of Canada’s Foreign […]
title: Miliitary Intelligence Member Charged Over Secrets Leak Allegedly Exposed Covert Operator’s Identity: Court Docs

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Top political minds in the US have warned against ignoring the threats of Islamist extremism in Australia.
title: Bondi Massacre Result of ‘Massive Islamist Influx’ to Australia: US Intelligence Director

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The federal government has launched two digital ID and wallet apps for certain licensing and permitting purposes that are currently in “early access” on app stores. Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) told The Epoch Times in a statement that the government is developing “GC Issue and Verify,” which will enable the feds to issue […]
title: Federal Government Launches Early Versions of Digital IDs for Some Permits and Licences

author: AAP
description: Authorities are seeking urgent confirmation after reports emerged that an Australian may have been killed while fighting in Ukraine.
title: Australian Man Feared Killed Near Front Line in Ukraine War

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Ontario Provincial Police (OPP) and the Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) have arrested 20 individuals and recovered more than 300 stolen vehicles as part of a major auto theft investigation into a criminal organization shipping stolen vehicles overseas. The investigation, known as Project Chickadee, began in August 2023 when the OPP recovered four stolen […]
title: OPP, CBSA Arrest 20 People, Recover More Than 300 Vehicles in Major Auto Theft Investigation

author: Noé Chartier
description: Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne said G7 countries need a common approach to facing some of China’s trade practices as Ottawa increases interactions with Beijing. Champagne made the comment during a press conference with reporters from Berlin on Dec. 17, at the end of a European trip with stops in Paris and London to meet with […]
title: China’s Non-Market Practices Need Common G7 Approach: Minister Champagne

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Elections Alberta has announced two new recall petitions approved against Alberta’s Minister of Justice Mickey Amery and United Conservative Party (UCP) MLA Jackie Armstrong-Homeniuk. With the Dec. 17 notice of the two approved petitions, 22 UCP members, including Alberta Premier Danielle Smith, are now facing recall petitions, representing almost half of the UCP’s 47-member caucus. […]
title: Recall Petition Approved Against Alberta Justice Minister Mickey Amery, Additional UCP MLA

author: Chandra Philip
description: The Alberta government said it will be testing higher speed limits on selected highways in the new year in a “mini-trial” that could see further changes in the province. The decision follows a five-week online survey where the government asked residents to share comments about increasing the speed limit on some highways by 10 kilometres […]
title: Alberta to Increase Speed Limit to 120 Kilometres per Hour on Some Highways in ‘Mini-Trial’

author: Catherine Yang
description: Lawmakers and researchers sound the alarm on the academic loophole that enables the sharing of sensitive research with China.
title: Energy Department Funded Chinese Defense, Quantum Research, Lawmakers Find
